channel.title: Requesting a DRUGS section - due to rise in drug topics EVERYWHERE on the forum
channel.description:
Requesting a DRUGS section - due to rise in drug topics EVERYWHERE on the forum
That's pretty much my argument. If a new section isn't created, the debates section as well as a few other sections may be succumbed to "Where is the best website to buy Salvia?", "How can I smoke out of an empty can?" and "How many grams of Burpee Morning Glory seeds can I trip balls off of?"
That should be fun, but I'd rather have it in one section only. Any thoughts?

item.title: Requesting a DRUGS section - due to rise in drug topics EVERYWHERE on the forum
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:68, topic:197433”][quote author=Silver Lining link=topic=262075.msg2182643#msg2182643 date=1208053671]

To say caffeine is “physically” addicting while THC only “mentally” is rather hypocritical.

This is why I propose we abolish the physical- and mental- prefixes altogether, since they are meaningless anyway.

I kind of disagree because in the majority of cases, a physical addiction is going to be much harde to beat and it will have many more negative effects. With a mental addiction you just miss it, thats all.

Couldn’t your mind create something to make it want it more? Like it could create a headache or something if it wants to read but you’re trying stop [I know this sounds silly, but I’m having a hard time expressing what I mean].

Well, if you are addicted to a video game (mental addiction) do you get headaches? I suppose it’s possible, but for the majority of users you are going to simply miss it. I’ve quit pot for over 20 days now (going for a month), I miss it sometimes but it doesn’t even bother me tbh. I don’t know if I am considered mentally addicted, but I did do it just about everyday (sometimes several times a day).
[/quote]When I try to take a break from fapping, I get priapism.

lol, you take viagra?[/quote]No, my dick is just stubborn.

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting a DRUGS section - due to rise in drug topics EVERYWHERE on the forum
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:64, topic:197433”][quote author=jme link=topic=262075.msg2182462#msg2182462 date=1208049566]

To say caffeine is “physically” addicting while THC only “mentally” is rather hypocritical.

This is why I propose we abolish the physical- and mental- prefixes altogether, since they are meaningless anyway.

I kind of disagree because in the majority of cases, a physical addiction is going to be much harde to beat and it will have many more negative effects. With a mental addiction you just miss it, thats all.
[/quote]
Couldn’t your mind create something to make it want it more? Like it could create a headache or something if it wants to read but you’re trying stop [I know this sounds silly, but I’m having a hard time expressing what I mean].[/quote]

Well, if you are addicted to a video game (mental addiction) do you get headaches? I suppose it’s possible, but for the majority of users you are going to simply miss it. I’ve quit pot for over 20 days now (going for a month), I miss it sometimes but it doesn’t even bother me tbh. I don’t know if I am considered mentally addicted, but I did do it just about everyday (sometimes several times a day).

Read full topic

BLA BLA BLA MY NAME IS RON AND I’M GOOD AT MAKING LARGE IMPORTANT POSTS, I DO NOT MIND IF DAVIDUDE36 WANTS TO MAKE HIS POST SMALLER BY NOT QUOTING MY MASSIVE POST.
[/quote]
See if we had a drug section people would be able to discuss wether they believe it addictive etc etc.[/quote]

bootnecklad:

Mopar should make one.

Then we can discuss if we need it, so it’ll be in the right section

Tree:

I agree that there is areas of drug taking that do need to be debated, though creating a section for it is not needed. This idea fails more than my DVD rewinder.

LOL
